scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains business letters to John Wesley Hunt in Lexington, Kentucky, as well as account statements including goods purchased by John W. Hunt, two bills of exchange to give John W. Hunt money, and John C. Owings' receipt of a voucher. Also included is an agreement between Mr. Beall and George Nicholas along with papers and memorandums related to credits claimed by Mr. Beall. The business letters from associates include Ralph Phillips asking John W. Hunt for help getting his Kentucky land back, letters asking Hunt to settle his accounts, and letters regarding debts owed to Hunt. Letters in this folder also show that John W. Hunt has begun selling cotton bagging of good quality, which he will sell at a reduced price until European importation ends and then raise the prices.
